intro: Isachne myosotis var. minor, commonly known as the lesser forget-me-not, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, soft pubescence. Native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade. This plant is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and along stream banks, where it contributes to biodiversity and provides nectar for pollinators.
